t: For the choir director. A psalm of David.
How*pn long, Lord?*s Will you forget me forever? How*ln long will you hide your face from me?
How*ln long will I store up anxious concerns within me, agony*ln in my mind every day? How*ln long will my enemy dominate me?
Consider*pn me and answer, Lord*s my God. Restore*ln brightness to my eyes; otherwise,*ln I will sleep in death.
My*ln enemy will say, “I have triumphed over him,” and*ln my foes will rejoice because I am shaken.
But*pn I have trusted in your faithful love; my*ln heart will rejoice in your deliverance.
I*ln will sing to the Lord*s because*ln he has treated me generously.
